item.title: Hampta Pass Journal Entries
item.description: 11 July ⁃ Making everyone hurry in the morning to get to the airport ⁃ But my phone had no charge, iphone cable doesn't work with power bank ⁃ TIL - 2 rupee lounge ⁃ Is Turbulence just driving in clouds => like going over potholes ⁃ Walk out of Delhi Airport - damn hot ⁃ Terrible terrible coffee ⁃ Bus ride - 500 kms - loud Dhaba with randos signing in Haryanvi 12 July ⁃ Raining and hair pin bendy roads all the way to Manali ⁃ Get ready fast, submit all docs ⁃ Goto start point of trek in sumo, at top ⁃ Crows seems to be there at the top of the mountains for some reason unlike pigeons in Manali.

item.title: Logging in Drupal
item.description: Setting up logging today prevents the headache tommorow Components syslog - inbuilt drupal module to log drupal errors(no particular reason for choosing this module, can use any appropriate module that logs to file or write a module that implements hook_watchdog) logrotate - to archive the old logs to help classify by data and save space. Steps We enable syslog in the modules in drupal and save with the default config add a file in /etc/rsyslog.

item.title: The Most Important Design Guideline
item.description: In college we were taught SOLID and GRASP principles which was more heuristics than principles1 that was supposed to make our code better. I honestly don't know whether applying them helps as I never could remember it and I definitely wasn't thinking about applying it when I was writing code. But one thing that did stay with me from college that was taught and repeated dozens of times by a great professor was the idea of interface and implementation, which was beautifully taught in C++ with the interface being written in the header file and the implementation being written in the library source file.

item.title: Building Endurance the Right Way
item.description: Notes taken while listening to Building Endurance the Right Way Aspects to Endurance - Cardio & Muscular How to develop cardio Steady state exercise - run at particular speed not too fast Cause: Heart stretches when you increase heart rate upto a certain point which increases stroke volume(means a bigger heart) Running at increased heart rate (90% +), heart is twitching and not effective

item.title: ESG Stocks
item.description: I have a definitely-not-well-thought-out theory about ESG(Environmental, Social and Goverance) stocks. Hunch: ESG stocks will continue to generally always give better returns than the overall stock market. In 10th grade I remember our English teacher asking whether it is moral for a person to own a luxury car since it is so polluting and one of my classmates made the point that people buy luxury cars as status symbol.

item.title: Nightcrawler
item.description: For the first time ever, I ran a 4k in the night at 11:30 PM around my apartment, that too after staying up for a software release. People talk about starting your day fresh after a run inconveniantly missing out the part about waking up early in the morning, and hustling after the run to get to work on time. In contrast when you run at night, you really don't have anything to get back to except your bed and when you do get back you obviously will sleep like a log cause you are tired after running.

item.title: Bangalore Half Marathon 2019 Race Report
item.description: Overall my memory of the race is very hazy and I remeber very specific parts of the race with not much long term context to it The beginning parts of the race involved a lot of shifting between lanes as some people were running slow and it was still relatively crowded approx for atleast 5-7 kms. The course through cubbon park was generally very cool and the air there was very fresh.

item.title: Terribly plain photos
item.description: If you are going to put up some pictures on the internet you’ve got to atleast put up nice aesthetic color-graded shots or atleast have some person in it, unless you are me in which case you can put up pictures of random things, label it terribly and get away with it. Don't be shy little frog Trails are not always softer than the road to run on One season later --- Ouch that must really hurt --- Lonely Bush in the middle of the trail --- Breakfast I --- Breakfast II --- Breakfast III --- Top Secret Location --- Kaccha Mango Bite
